cards.back: A fundamental property of matter. Like charges repel; opposite charges attract. Measured in Coulombs (C).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: A region around a charged object where other charges experience electric force. Field lines show direction.
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The electric potential energy per unit charge at a point. Measured in Volts (V).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The rate of flow of electric charge. Current = Charge/Time. Measured in Amperes (A).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The difference in electric potential between two points. Voltage = Work/Charge. Measured in Volts (V).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The opposition to electric current flow. Resistance = Voltage/Current. Measured in Ohms (Ω).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The rate at which electrical energy is transferred. Power = Voltage × Current. Measured in Watts (W).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The ability of a capacitor to store electric charge. Capacitance = Charge/Voltage. Measured in Farads (F).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The ability of an inductor to store energy in a magnetic field. Measured in Henries (H).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity

cards.back: The relationship between voltage, current, and resistance: V = IR (Voltage = Current × Resistance).
cards.subject: Physics - Electricity
